In Argentina, Javier Milei is facing a governing crisis three months before the legislative elections
subhead: As the extensive powers granted to him by Congress in June 2024 have expired, the Argentine president is facing emboldened opposition as the midterm legislative elections approach.

title: Hulk Hogan, professional wrestling icon, dies at age 71
subhead: Hogan, born Terry Bollea, was perhaps the biggest star in WWE's history, and also built a successful entertainment career, starring in multiple films and TV shows. He died Thursday morning of cardiac arrest.

title: Montmartre residents denounce the Paris neighborhood's 'Disneyfication'
subhead: Rising numbers of tourists and increasingly exasperated residents have made coexistence difficult in Paris' 18th arrondissement, where the effects of overtourism are becoming ever more visible.

title: Israeli government openly aims to depopulate Gaza
subhead: Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition is using hunger as a weapon to pressure Palestinians to abandon their land. Its objective is to concentrate them in a so-called 'humanitarian city' in the south of the enclave, as a precursor to their possible transfer to foreign countries.

subhead: The Sahelian branch of Al-Qaeda, primarily active in Mali and Burkina Faso, has acquired the capacity to arm low-cost devices. This recent expertise has inflicted heavy losses on national armies.

title: Syrian commission of inquiry releases report on mass killings in Alawite regions
subhead: The identities of 1,426 victims of the massacres committed in March have been confirmed, and a 'provisional' list of 298 suspects has been drawn up. Yet NGOs fear that the absence of any charges brought against military leaders will lead to a cycle of vengeance and impunity.
